parameters.Name: ACT_BND
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Units of activity [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Since inter-/extrapolation default is MIG, the bound must be explicitly specified for each period, unless an inter-/extrapolation option is set. If the bound is specified for a timeslice s above the process timeslice resolution (prc_tsl), the bound is applied to the sum of the activity variables according to the timeslice tree. Standard aggregation.
parameters.Description: Bound on the overall activity a process.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Activity limit constraint (EQ(l)_ACTBND) when s is above prc_tsl. Direct bound on activity variable (VAR_ACT) when at the prc_tsl level.

parameters.Name: ACT_COST
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per unit of activity [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Description: Variable costs associated with the activity of a process.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the activity variable (VAR_ACT) as a component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR). May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: ACT_CSTPL
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per unit of activity [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Used as an alternative or supplement to using ACT_LOSPL(r,y,p,'FX'). When used as an alternative, the fuel increase at the minimum operating level that should be included in the cost penalty must be embedded in the ACT_CSTPL coefficient.
parameters.Description: Partial load cost penalty, defined as an additional cost per activity at the minimum operating level, corresponding to the efficiency loss at that load level. Added as an extra term to variable costs in the objective and reporting.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Generates an additional term in EQ_OBJVAR for the increase in operating cost.

parameters.Name: ACT_CSTRMP
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency unit per unit of capacity (change in load) [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Can be used for standard processes in basic, advanced and discrete unit commitment extensions. Can also be used for load-shifting processes for defining the cost of shifting loads per unit of demand load by one hour.
parameters.Description: Defines ramp-up (L=UP) or ramp-down (L=LO) cost per unit of load change (in capacity units). For load-shifting processes defines the cost of shifting one unit of load by one hour, forward (UP) or backward (LO).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Activates generation of EQ_ACTRMPC. Generates an additional term in EQ_OBJVAR for the increase in operating cost.

parameters.Name: ACT_CSTSD
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency units per unit of started-up capacity [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Activates the advanced unit commitment option. In the case of the shut-down costs, only the tuple (upt, bd) = (HOT, LO) is a valid instance for this parameter. Requires the parameter ACT_MAXNON to be defined as well.
parameters.Description: Defines start-up (bd=UP) and shutdown costs (bd=LO) per unit of started-up capacity, differentiated by start-up type (upt). The start-up type of a power plant depends on its non-operational time after shut-down, as defined by using ACT_MAXNON.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Generates an additional term in EQ_OBJVAR for the increase in operating cost.

parameters.Name: ACT_CSTUP
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per unit of capacity [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: The tslvl level refers to the timeslice cycle for which the start-up cost is defined. Only applicable when the min. stable operating level has been defined with ACT_MINLD.
parameters.Description: Cost of process start-up per unit of started-up capacity. Added as an extra term to variable costs in the objective and reporting.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Activates generation of EQL_ACTUPS eqs. Generates an additional term in the variable operating costs included in EQ_OBJVAR.

parameters.Name: ACT_CUM
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Activity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: The years y1 and y2 may be any years of the set allyear; where y1 may also be 'BOH' for first year of first period and y2 may be 'EOH' for last year of last period.
parameters.Description: Bound on the cumulative amount of annual process activity between the years y1 and y2, within a region.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Generates an instance of the cumulative constraint (EQ_CUMFLO)

parameters.Name: ACT_EFF
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Activity unit per flow unit [0,∞); Default value: none; Default group efficiency =1 when values are specified only for individual commodities. Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: The group cg may be a single commodity, group, or commodity type on the shadow side, or a single commodity in the PCG; cg='ACT' refers to the default shadow group. If no group efficiency is defined, shadow group is assumed to be the commodity type. Individual commodity efficiencies are multiplied with the shadow group efficiency (default=1). Levelized to the timeslice level of the flow variables in the shadow group. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Activity efficiency for process, i.e. amount of activity per unit of commodity flows in the group cg. For more information on usage, see Section 6.3 for details about EQE_ACTEFF.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Generates instances of the activity efficiency constraint (EQE_ACTEFF)

parameters.Name: ACT_FLO
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Flow unit per activity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Inherited/aggregated to the timeslice levels of the the process flow (cg=com) or the process activity (when cg=genuine group). Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Flow of commodities in cg in proportion to the process activity, in timeslice s. Non-vintaged variant available for vintaged processes by using a negative FLO_FUNCX.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Establishes a transformation relationship (EQ_PTRANS) between the flows in the PCG and one or more input (or output) commodities.

parameters.Name: ACT_LOSPL
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,∞); default values: FX: none, LO: default value is ACT_MINLD or 0.1 if that is not defined, UP: 0.6; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Endogenous partial load modeling can only be used for processes that have their efficiency modelled by the ACT_EFF parameter, which must be defined on the shadow side of the process. For other processes, the ACT_CSTPL parameter can be used for modeling a cost penalty at partial loads.
parameters.Description: Partial load efficiency parameters. 1) (bd='FX'): Proportional increase in specific fuel consumption at minimum operating level 2) (bd='LO'): Minimum operating level of partial load operation 3) (bd='UP'): Fraction of feasible load range above the minimum operating level, below which the efficiency losses are assumed to occur.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Generates instances of the partial load efficiency constraint EQ_ACTPL.

parameters.Name: ACT_LOSSD
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Dimensionless [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Can only be used when the advanced unit commitment option is used for the process (therefore, defining both ACT_CSTSD and ACT_MAXNON is required). Requires also that ACT_EFF has been used for defining the process efficiency (on the shadow side of the process).
parameters.Description: Used for modeling endogenous partial load efficiency losses during the start-up and shut-down phase. ·With bd=UP defines increase in specific fuel consumption at the start up load level defined by the ratio ACT_MINLD / ACT_SDTIME(upt,'UP') for start-up type upt; ·With bd=LO defines the increase in specific fuel consumption at the start up load level defined by the ratio ACT_MINLD / ACT_SDTIME('HOT', 'LO').
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Activates generation of EQ_SUDPLL

parameters.Name: ACT_MAXNON
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: hours [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Can only be used when the advanced unit commitment option is used for the process (thus defining ACT_CSTSD is required)
parameters.Description: Max. non-operational time before transition to next stand-by condition, by start-up type, in hours ·Defines the max. non-operational time before a subsequent start-up of type upt.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Activates generation of EQ_SUDUPT

parameters.Name: ACT_MINLD
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Can only be used for standard processes (not IRE or STG). Must be defined if ACT_CSTUP or ACT_TIME is specified.
parameters.Description: Minimum stable operating level of a dispatchable process.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Generates instances of equations EQ_CAPLOAD and EQE_ACTUPS.

parameters.Name: ACT_SDTIME
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: hours [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Can only be used when ACT_CSTSD is specified for the process (advanced unit commitment option). When specifying the duration of the shut-down phase, only the tuple (upt,bd)=(HOT,LO) is valid
parameters.Description: Defines the duration of start-up (bd=UP) and shut-down (bd=LO) phases, by start-up type, in hours.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Activates generation of EQ_SUDTIME, and used also in the equations EQ_ACTPL, EQ_SDSLANT, EQ_SDMINON, EQ_SUDPLL

parameters.Name: ACT_TIME
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Hours [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Can be used for standard processes when start-up costs have been modeled, using both ACT_MINLD and ACT_CSTUP at the DAYNITE/WEEKLY level. The lim type 'FX' is not supported for this use, and is ignored. Can also be used for load-shifting storage processes, for defining the maximum delay/advance of load shift, or the time-window for load balancing (cf. Sect. 4.3.9).
parameters.Description: 1) Minimum online (UP) / offline (LO) hours of a process with start-up costs modeled (lim=LO/UP) 2) Maximum number of start-up cycles within process time-slice cycles (lim=N). 3) Maximum delay or advance of load shift (lim=UP/LO/FX) or load balancing time (lim=N) for a load-shifting storage.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Generates instances of EQL_ACTUPC. For load-shifting storage processes, generates instances of EQ_SLSIFT.

parameters.Name: ACT_UPS
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Inherited/aggregated to the timeslice levels of the process activity. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation. The ramp rates can only be specified with bd=LO/UP.
parameters.Description: Maximum ramp-rate (down/up) of process activity as a fraction of nominal on-line capacity per hour.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Generates instances of equation EQ_ACTRAMP.

parameters.Name: B
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Year; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Required for each milestone year, but is auto-generated if not specified
parameters.Description: Beginning year of period t.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: BS_BNDPRS
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity unit of the process [0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Not levelized (inherited or aggregated), but applied only directly on the timeslice s specified. See the ABS documentation for details
parameters.Description: Absolute bound on the reserve provision b from process p.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BS27

parameters.Name: BS_CAPACT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Flow unit / capacity unit; (0,∞); default value: PRC_CAPACT
parameters.Details/Notes: Applied also for the reporting of reserves in terms of power levels. See the ABS documentation for details
parameters.Description: Conversion factor from exogenous reserve demand from capacity to activity / commodity flow units
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BS04

parameters.Name: BS_DELTA
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: dimensionless [0,∞); default value: 1
parameters.Details/Notes: Levelized to COM_TSL of b. Calibration parameters for probabilistic reserve demand b, in region r, and timeslice s. See the ABS documentation for details
parameters.Description: Calibration parameters for probabilistic reserve demand
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BS03

parameters.Name: BS_DEMDET
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Unit for EXOGEN: capacity unit; Unit for WMAXSI: dimensionless (fraction of capacity); Default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: rsp='EXOGEN': Exogenous reserve demand for reserve b, in region r, timeslice s. rsp='WMAXSI': Weight of the contribution of the largest system element in deterministic reserve demand b, in region r, timeslice s. See the ABS documentation for details
parameters.Description: Parameters for deterministic demands of reserves (rsp = EXOGEN or WMAXSI)
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BS04

parameters.Name: BS_DETWT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: dimensionless [0,1]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: See the ABS documentation for details.
parameters.Description: Weight of the deterministic component in the formulation for endogenous requirements of reserve b in region r
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BS03

parameters.Name: BS_LAMBDA
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: dimensionless (0,1]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Required. If not defined, then the demand for reserve b cannot be calculated. See the ABS documentation for details.
parameters.Description: Fudge factors for dependencies in the reserve requirements calculated for reserve b in region r, in year datayear
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BS03

parameters.Name: BS_MAINT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: hours (if over 24 hours, continuous over whole season) (0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Levelized to PRC_TSL. If defined on DAYNITE or WEEKLY level, requires start-ups explicitly enabled on that level (using ACT_CSTUP/ACT_CSTSD).
parameters.Description: For endogenous maintenance scheduling, defines minimum continuous maintenance time of process p
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BS27, EQ_BS28

parameters.Name: BS_OMEGA
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Unit: dimensionless {1,2,3}; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Required for enabling reserve provision formulation. Levelized to COM_TSL of b. See the ABS documentation for details
parameters.Description: Indicator denoting if the demand for reserve b is the weighted sum of the deterministic and probabilistic component ( ω=2), the maximum of the two (ω=1), or their difference ( ω=3)
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BS03

parameters.Name: BS_RMAX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Unit: dimensionless (fraction of capacity) [0, 1]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Required for enabling reserve provision from any non-storage processes. Levelized to PRC_TSL. See the ABS documentation for details
parameters.Description: Maximum contribution of process p, in timeslice s to the provision of reserve commodity b.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BS11, EQ_BS19

parameters.Name: BS_RTYPE
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Unit: dimensionless {±1, ±2, ±3, ±4}; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Required for enabling reserve provision calculations. See the ABS documentation for details
parameters.Description: Type of reserve commodity b, positive or negative ± 1–4: ±1 : FCR reserve, ±2 : AFRR reserve, ±3 : MFRR reserve, ±4 : RR reserve
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BS00, EQ_BS01, EQ_BS11, EQ_BS18, EQ_BS19, EQ_BS26

parameters.Name: BS_SHARE
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Unit: dimensionless [0, 1]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: The group grp can be defined by GR_GENMAP, or implicitly for any single process prc=grp. See the ABS documentation for details
parameters.Description: Maximum (bd=UP) or minimum (bd=LO) share of process group grp in the demand for reserve b, in region r, where demand is measured as defined by BS_OMEGA
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BS01

parameters.Name: BS_SIGMA
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Unit: dimensionless (0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Levelized to finest ts-level. See the ABS documentation for details
parameters.Description: Standard deviation of forecast error for the imbalance source grp, in region r, timeslice s, used for calculating the demand for reserve b
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BS03

parameters.Name: BS_STIME
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Unit: hours (0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Required that 'UP' ≥ 'LO'. See the ABS documentation for details
parameters.Description: Defines the times for reserve provision from storage process p for reserve b in region r(in hours): ·bd='LO': Time required to ramp up in order to provide reserve b ·bd='UP': Duration of provision for reserve b including time to ramp up
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BS22, EQ_BS23

parameters.Name: CAP_BND
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Since inter-/extrapolation is default is MIG, a bound must be specified for each period desired, if no explicit inter-/extrapolation option is given. Relaxed if upper bound less than existing non-retirable capacity.
parameters.Description: Bound on investment in new capacity. Imposes an indirect limit on the capacity transfer equation (EQ_CPT) by means of a direct bound on the capacity variable (VAR_CAP).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: CM_CONST
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Constant specific unit [open]; See Appendix for defaults
parameters.Details/Notes: See Appendix on Climate Module for details.
parameters.Description: Various climate module constants, e.g. phi and sigma values between reservoirs.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_CLITOT, EQ_CLICONC, EQ_CLITEMP, EQ_CLIBEOH

parameters.Name: CM_EXOFORC
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Forcing unit [open]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Default values are provided. See Appendix on Climate Module for details.
parameters.Description: Radiative forcing from exogenous sources
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_CLITOT

parameters.Name: CM_GHGMAP
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Units of climate module emissions per units of regional emissions [0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: The global emissions in the climate module (cm_var) are 'CO2-GtC' (GtC), 'CH4-Mt' (Mt) and 'N2O-Mt' (Mt). See Appendix on Climate Module for details.
parameters.Description: Mapping and conversion of regional GHG emissions to global emissions in the climate module
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_CLITOT

parameters.Name: CM_HISTORY
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Climate variable unit [0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Default values are provided until 2010. See Appendix on Climate Module for details.
parameters.Description: Calibration values for CO2 and forcing
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_CLITOT, EQ_CLICONC, EQ_CLITEMP, EQ_CLIBEOH

parameters.Name: CM_LINFOR
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Forcing unit per concentration unit [open]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: With lim types LO/UP, CO2 forcing function can be automatically linearized between the concentration levels given. For CH4 and N2O, lim types FX/N must be used (N=concentration multiplier, FX=constant term). See Appendix on Climate Module for details.
parameters.Description: Parameters of linearized forcing functions
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_CLITOT

parameters.Name: CM_MAXC
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Climate variable unit [0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Since no default inter-/extrapolation, bounds must be explicitly specified for each desired year, unless an explicit inter-/extrapolation option is set. See Appendix on Climate Module for details.
parameters.Description: Maximum level of climate variable
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_CLIMAX

parameters.Name: COM_AGG
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity units [open]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: When commodity lim_type is LO and commodity type is not DEM, VAR_COMNET of c1 is aggregated to c2; When commodity lim_type is FX/N or commodity type is DEM, VAR_COMPRD of c1 is aggregated to c2.
parameters.Description: Aggregation of commodity NET/PRD production to the production side of the balance of another commodity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Adds a term in EQ(l)_COMBAL and EQ(l)_COMPRD.

parameters.Name: COM_BNDNET
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Remark: All VAR_COMNET variables are by default non-negative, i.e. have lower bounds of zero. Since inter-/extrapolation default is MIG, a bound must be specified for each period desired, if no explicit inter-/extrapolation option is given. If the bound is specified for a timeslice s above the commodity timeslice resolution (com_tsl), the bound is applied to the sum of the net commodity variables (VAR_COMNET) below it, according to the timeslice tree. Standard aggregation.
parameters.Description: Limit on the net amount of a commodity (variable VAR_COMNET) within a region for a particular timeslice.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The balance constraint is set to an equality (EQE_COMBAL). Either the finer timeslice variables are summed (EQ(l)_BNDNET) or the bound applied direct to the commodity net variable(VAR_COMNET) when at the commodity level (com_tsl).

parameters.Name: COM_BNDPRD
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Remark: All VAR_COMPRD variables are by default non-negative, i.e. have lower bounds of zero. Since inter-/extrapolation default is MIG, a bound must be specified for each period desired, if no explicit inter-/extrapolation option is given. If the bound is specified for a timeslice s being above the commodity timeslice resolution (com_tsl), the bound is applied to the sum of the commodity production variables (VAR_COMPRD) below it, according to the timeslice tree. Standard aggregation.
parameters.Description: Limit on the amount of a commodity produced (variable VAR_COMPRD) within a region for a particular timeslice.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The balance constraint is set to an equality (EQE_COMBAL). Finer timeslice variables summed (EQ(l)_BNDPRD). or the bound is applied direct to the commodity production variable (VAR_COMPRD) when at the commodity level (com_tsl).

parameters.Name: COM_BPRICE
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per commodity unit [open]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: The control parameter $SET TIMESED ‘YES’ to activate elastic demands must be set.
parameters.Description: Base price of a demand commodity for the elastic demand formulation.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Controls the inclusion of the elastic demand variable (VAR_ELAST) in the commodity balance equation(EQ(l)_COMBAL). Applied to the elastic demand variable (VAR_ELAST) in the objective function (EQ_OBJELS).

parameters.Name: COM_CSTNET
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per commodity unit [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Cost on the net amount of a commodity within a region for a particular timeslice.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Forces the net commodity variable (VAR_COMNET) to be included in the equality balance constraint (EQE_COMBAL). Applied to said variable in the cost component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: COM_CSTPRD
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per commodity unit [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Cost on the production of a commodity, within a region for a particular timeslice.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Forces the commodity production variable (VAR_COMPRD) to be included in the equality balance constraint (EQE_COMBAL). Applied to said variable in the cost component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: COM_CUMNET
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: The years y1 and y2 may be any years of the set allyear; where y1 may also be ‘BOH’ for first year of first period and y2 may be ‘EOH’ for last year of last period.
parameters.Description: Bound on the cumulative net amount of a commodity between the years y1 and y2, within a region over timeslices.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Forces the net commodity variable (VAR_COMNET) to be included in the equality balance constraint (EQE_COMBAL). Generates the cumulative commodity constraint (EQ(l)_CUMNET).

parameters.Name: COM_CUMPRD
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: The years y1 and y2 may be any years of the set allyear; where y1 may also be ‘BOH’ for first year of first period and y2 may be ‘EOH’ for last year of last period.
parameters.Description: Bound on the cumulative production of a commodity between the years y1 and y2 within a region over timeslices.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Forces the net commodity variable (VAR_COMPRD) to be included in the balance equation (EQE_COMBAL). The cumulative constraint is generated (EQ(l)_CUMPRD).

parameters.Name: COM_ELAST
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Dimensionless [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: The control parameter $SET TIMESED YES must be set to activate elastic demands. An elasticity is required for each direction the demand is permitted to move. The index lim = 'LO' corresponds to demand decrease, while lim = 'UP' denotes the direction for demand increase. A different value may be provided for each direction, thus curves may be asymmetric. Substitution elasticities can be defined with lim='N', among a group of demands aggregated by COM_AGG.
parameters.Description: Elasticity of demand indicating how much the demand rises/falls in response to a unit change in the marginal cost of meeting a demand that is elastic. See also Appendix D for additional details on defining demand functions.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Controls the inclusion of the elastic demand variable (VAR_ELAST) in the commodity balance equation(EQ(l)_COMBAL). Applied to the elastic demand variable (VAR_ELAST) in the objective function costs (EQ_OBJELS).

parameters.Name: COM_ELASTX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer scalar [1,999]; default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when shaping of elasticity based upon demand level is desired. Note: Shape index 1 is reserved for constant 1.
parameters.Description: Shape index for the elasticity of demand
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Affects the demand elasticities applied in EQ_OBJELS

parameters.Name: COM_FR
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,1]; default value: timeslice duration (G_YRFR); Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Normally defined only for demand commodities (com_type = 'DEM'), but can be applied to any commodity for defining load profiles. Affects timeslice resolution at which a commodity is tracked (RTCS_TSFR), and thereby may affect when a process cannot operate (rtps_off). Weighted inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Fraction of the annual demand (COM_PROJ) or commodity flow occurring in timeslice s; describes the shape of the load curve.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the annual demand (COM_PROJ) as the RHS of the balance equation (EQ(l)_COMBAL). Enters the peaking equation (EQ_PEAK), if a peaking commodity. Applied to the bounds of elastic demand step variables (VAR_ELAST). Applied via RTFCS_FR in all equations to flows having a timeslice level coarser than target level.

parameters.Name: COM_IE
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction (0,∞); default value: 1; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Infrastructure or transmission efficiency of a commodity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Overall efficiency applied to the total production of a commodity in the commodity balance equation (EQ(l)_COMBAL).

parameters.Name: COM_MSHGV
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Unit: dimensionless (0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Required for all markets modeled with the logit market sharing mechanism
parameters.Description: In the logit market sharing mechanism, defines heterogeneity value for market c in region r, between the investment choices
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_MSNCAPB

parameters.Name: COM_PKFLX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Scalar [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Difference between the average demand and the peak demand in timeslice s, expressed as fraction of the average demand.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the total consumption of a commodity to raise the capacity needed to satisfy the peaking constraint (EQ_PEAK).

parameters.Name: COM_PKRSV
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Scalar [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Requires that commodity c is also requested to have peaking constraints, by defining COM_PEAK or COM_PKTS
parameters.Description: Peak reserve margin as fraction of peak demand, e.g. if COM_PKRSV = 0.2, the total installed capacity must exceed the peak load by 20%.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the total consumption of a commodity to raise the capacity needed to satisfy the peaking constraint (EQ_PEAK).

parameters.Name: COM_PROJ
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: In standard usage, only applicable to demand commodities (com_type = ‘DEM’). In advanced usage, may also be specified for other commodities for defining an exogenous demand. Demand is allocated to sub-annual timeslices according to COM_FR.
parameters.Description: Projected annual demand for a commodity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Serves as the RHS (after COM_FR applied) of the commodity balance constraint (EQ(l)_COMBAL). Enters the peaking equation (EQ_PEAK), if a peaking commodity. Applied when setting the upper bound of an elastic demand step (VAR_ELAST).

parameters.Name: COM_STEP
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer number [1,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: The control parameter $SET TIMESED ‘YES’ must be set.
parameters.Description: Number of steps to use for the approximation of change of producer/consumer surplus when using the linearized elastic demand formulations.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Controls the instance of the elastic demand variable (VAR_ELAST).

parameters.Name: COM_VOC
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Dimensionless [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: The control parameter $SET TIMESED ‘YES’ to be set to activate elastic demands must be set. A number is required for each direction the demand is permitted to move. The index bd = LO corresponds to the direction of decreasing the demand, while bd = UP denotes the direction for demand increase. A different value may be provided for each direction, thus curves may be asymmetric.
parameters.Description: Possible variation of demand in both directions when using the elastic demand formulation.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied when setting the bound of an elastic demand step (VAR_ELAST). Applied to the elasticity variable in the objective function costs (EQ_OBJELS).

parameters.Name: COM_SUBNET
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Subsidy on the net amount of a commodity within a region for a particular timeslice.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Forces the net commodity variable (VAR_COMNET) to be included in the equality balance constraint (EQE_COMBAL). Applied (-) to said variable in the cost component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: COM_SUBPRD
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Subsidy on the production of a commodity within a region for a particular timeslice.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Forces the commodity production variable (VAR_COMPRD) to be included in the equality balance constraint (EQE_COMBAL). Applied (-) to said variable in the cost component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: COM_TAXNET
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Tax on the net amount of a commodity within a region for a particular timeslice.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Forces the net commodity variable (VAR_COMNET) to be included in the equality balance constraint (EQE_COMBAL). Applied to said variable in the cost component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: COM_TAXPRD
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Tax on the production of a commodity within a region for a particular timeslice.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Forces the commodity production variable (VAR_COMPRD) to be included in the equality balance constraint (EQE_COMBAL). Applied to said variable in the cost component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: DAM_BQTY
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: Only effective when DAM_COST has been defined for commodity c.
parameters.Description: Base quantity of emissions for damage cost accounting
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_DAMAGE, EQ_OBJDAM

parameters.Name: DAM_COST
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Damage costs are by default endogenous (included in the objective). To set them exogenous, use $SET DAMAGE NO
parameters.Description: Marginal damage cost of emissions at Base quantity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_DAMAGE, EQ_OBJDAM

parameters.Name: DAM_ELAST
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Dimensionless [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: Only effective when DAM_COST has been defined for commodity c.
parameters.Description: Elasticity of damage cost in the lower or upper direction from Base quantity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_OBJDAM

parameters.Name: DAM_STEP
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer number [1,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: Only effective when DAM_COST has been defined for commodity c.
parameters.Description: Number of steps for linearizing damage costs in the lower or upper direction from Base quantity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_DAMAGE, EQ_OBJDAM

parameters.Name: DAM_VOC
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction LO: [0,1]; UP: [0, ∞); default value: none; Default i/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: Only effective when DAM_COST is defined for c. Step sizes proportional to the Base quantity can be defined with lim='N'.
parameters.Description: Variance of emissions in the lower or upper direction from Base quantity as a fraction of Base quantity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_OBJDAM

parameters.Name: E
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Year; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: For each model year period
parameters.Description: End year of period t, used in determining the length of each period
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Affects EQ(l)_CPT, EQ_OBJINV.

parameters.Name: FLO_BND
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit [0,∞); default: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: If the bound is specified for a timeslice s being above the flow timeslice resolution (rtpcs_varf), the bound is applied to the sum of the flow variables (VAR_FLO) according to the timeslice tree, otherwise directly to the flow variable. No aggregation.
parameters.Description: Bound on the flow of a commodity or the sum of flows within a commodity group.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Flow activity limit constraint (EQ(l)_FLOBND) when s is above rtpcs_varf Direct bound on activity variable (VAR_FLO) when at the rtpcs_varf level.

parameters.Name: FLO_COST
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per commodity unit [open]; default: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation
parameters.Description: Variable cost of a process associated with the production/ consumption of a commodity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the flow variable (VAR_FLO) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR). May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: FLO_CUM
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Flow unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: The years y1 and y2 may be any years of the set allyear; where y1 may also be 'BOH' for first year of first period and y2 may be 'EOH' for last year of last period.
parameters.Description: Bound on the cumulative amount of annual process flow between the years y1 and y2, within a region.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Generates an instance of the cumulative constraint (EQ_CUMFLO)

parameters.Name: FLO_DELIV
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per commodity unit [open]; default: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Cost of delivering (consuming) a commodity to a process.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the flow variable (VAR_FLO) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR). May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: FLO_EFF
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit of c / commodity unit of cg [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Inherited/aggregated to the timeslice levels of the flow variables of the commodities in group cg. All parameters with the same process (p) and target commodity (c) are combined in the same transformation equation. By using cg='ACT', the attribute will be defined per unit of activity, by applying it on all PCG flows with the value divided by any user-defined PRC_ACTFLO. FLO_EFF defined for an individual flow will override any value for a group.
parameters.Description: Defines the amount of commodity flow of commodity (c) per unit of other process flow(s) or activity (cg).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Generates process transformation equation (EQ_PTRANS) between one or more input (or output) commodities and one output (or input) commodities.

parameters.Name: FLO_EMIS
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit of c / commodity unit of cg [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: See FLO_EFF. If com is of type ENV and is not in the process topology, it is added to it as an output flow.
parameters.Description: Defines the amount of emissions (c) per unit of process flow(s) or activity (cg).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: See FLO_EFF.

parameters.Name: FLO_FR
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,1] / [0, ∞); default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: FLO_FR may be specified as lower, upper or fixed bounds, in contrast to COM_FR. Can be specified for any flow variable having a subannual timeslice resolution. Weighted aggregation. Direct inheritance, if defined at the ANNUAL level.
parameters.Description: 1) Bounds the flow of commodity (c) entering or leaving process (p) in a timeslice, in proportion to annual flow. 2) If specified also at the ANNUAL level, bounds the flow level in proportion to the average level under the parent timeslice
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: A share equation (EQ(l)_FLOFR) limiting the amount of commodity (c) is generated according to the bound type (bd = l indicator).

parameters.Name: FLO_FUNC
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit of cg2/commodity unit of cg1 [open]; default value: see details; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: If for the same indexes the parameter FLO_SUM is specified but no FLO_FUNC, the FLO_FUNC is set to 1. Important factor in determining the level at which a process operates in that the derived transformation parameter (COEF_PTRAN) is inherited/aggregated to the timeslice levels of the flow variables associated with the commodities in the group cg1.
parameters.Description: A key parameter describing the basic operation of or within a process. Sets the ratio between the sum of flows in commodity group cg2 to the sum of flows in commodity group cg1, thereby defining the efficiency of producing cg2 from cg1 (subject to any FLO_SUM). cg1 and cg2 may be also single commodities.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Establishes the basic transformation relationship (EQ_PTRANS) between one or more input (or output) commodities and one or more output (or input) commodities. Establishes the relationship between storage charging / discharging and a related commodity flow (VAR_FLO) in the auxiliary storage flow equation (EQ_STGAUX).

parameters.Name: FLO_FUNCX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer scalar [1,999]; default value: none; Default extrapolation: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when shaping based upon age is desired. Vintaged processes only (or for NCAP_COM flows). Note: Shape index 1 is reserved for constant 1. ACT_EFF(cg): cg1=cg, cg2='ACT'; ACT_FLO(cg): cg1='ACT', cg2=cg; FLO_EMIS(cg,c): cg1=cg2=c; FLO_EFF(cg,c): cg1=cg2=c; FLO_FUNC(cg1,cg2): cgN=cgN; NCAP_COM(com): cg1='CAPFLO', cg2=com
parameters.Description: Age-based shaping curve (SHAPE) to be applied to the flow parameters (ACT_EFF/ACT_FLO/ FLO_FUNC/FLO_SUM/ FLO_EMIS/FLO_EFF/ NCAP_COM)
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the flow variable (VAR_FLO) in a transformation equation (EQ_PTRANS / EQE_ACTEFF) to account for changes in the transformation efficiency according to the age of each process vintage.

parameters.Name: FLO_MARK
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,1]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: The same given fraction is applied to all timeslices of the commodity (this could be generalized to allow time-slice-specific fractions, if deemed useful). If an ANNUAL level market-share is desired for a timesliced commodity, PRC_MARK can be used instead.
parameters.Description: Process-wise market share in total commodity production.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The individual process flow variables (VAR_FLO, VAR_IN, VAR_STGIN/OUT) are constrained (EQ(l)_FLOMRK) to a fraction of the total production of a commodity (VAR_COMPRD). Forces the commodity production variable (VAR_COMPRD) to be included in the equality balance constraint (EQE_COMBAL).

parameters.Name: FLO_PKCOI
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Scalar [open]; default value: 1; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: FLO_PKCOI is specified for individual processes p consuming the peak commodity c. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation. Used when the timeslices are not necessarily fine enough to pick up the actual peak within the peak timeslices.
parameters.Description: Factor that permits attributing more (or less) demand to the peaking equation (EQ_PEAK) than the average demand calculated by the model, to handle the situation where peak usage is typically higher (or lower) due to coincidental (or non-coincidental) loads at the time of the peak demand.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the flow variable (VAR_FLO) to adjust the amount of a commodity consumed when considering the average demand contributing to the peaking constraint (EQ_PEAK).

parameters.Name: FLO_SHAR
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,1]; default value: none; Default i/e: MIG over milestoneyears, STD over pastyears
parameters.Details/Notes: Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation. A common example of using FLO_SHAR is to specify the power-to-heat ratio of CHP plants in the backpressure point. For example, for a heat output of a CHP technology, the FLO_SHAR parameter would have the value CHPR/(1+CHPR), with CHPR being the heat-to-power ratio.
parameters.Description: Share of flow commodity c based upon the sum of individual flows defined by the commodity group cg belonging to process p.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: When the commodity is an input an EQ(l)_INSHR equation is generated. When the commodity is an output an EQ(l)_OUTSHR equation is generated.

parameters.Name: FLO_SUB
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Subsidy on a process flow.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied with a minus sign to the flow variable (VAR_FLO) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR). May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: FLO_SUM
parameters.Related Sets/Parameters: FLO_FUNC, FLO_FUNCX, COEF_PTRANS, fs_emis, rpc_emis, rpc_ffunc, rpcg_ptran
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit of cg2/commodity unit of c [open]; default value: see details; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: If a FLO_SUM is specified and no corresponding FLO_FUNC, the FLO_FUNC is set to 1. If FLO_FUNC is specified for a true commodity group cg1, and no FLO_SUM is specified for the commodities in cg1, these FLO_SUM are set to 1. The derived parameter COEF_PTRANS is inherited/aggregated to the timeslice level of the flow variable of the commodity c.
parameters.Description: Multiplier applied for commodity c of group cg1 corresponding to the flow rate based upon the sum of individual flows defined by the commodity group cg2 of process p. Most often used to define the emission rate, or to adjust the overall efficiency of a technology based upon fuel consumed.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The FLO_SUM multiplier is applied along with FLO_FUNC parameter in the transformation coefficient (COEF_PTRANS), which is applied to the flow variable (VAR_FLO) in the transformation equation (EQ_PTRANS).

parameters.Name: FLO_TAX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per commodity unit [0,∞); default: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Tax on a process flow.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the flow variable (VAR_FLO) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR). May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: G_CUREX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Scalar (0,∞); Default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: The target currency cur2 must have a discount rate defined with G_DRATE.
parameters.Description: Conversion factor from currency cur1 to currency cur2, with cur2 to be used in the objective function.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Affects cost coefficients in EQ_OBJ

parameters.Name: G_CYCLE
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Number of cycles [1,∞); Default values: · 1 for ANNUAL · 1 for SEASON · 52 for WEEKLY · 365 for DAYNITE
parameters.Details/Notes: Not recommended to be changed; use TS_CYCLE instead, whenever the timeslice cycles are different from the default, because changing G_CYCLE would change the meaning of storage availability factors.
parameters.Description: Defines the total number of cycles on level tslvl, in a year. Provides default values for TS_CYCLE (see entry for that).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Affects interpretation of availability factors for the storage level, whenever capacity represents the maximum nominal output level (EQ(l)_CAPACT, EQL_CAPFLO).

parameters.Name: G_DRATE
parameters.Related Sets/Parameters: OBJ_DISC, OBJ_DCEOH, NCAP_DRATE, COR_SALVI, COR_SALVD, COEF_PVT, VDA_DISC
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction (0,1]; default value = none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: A value must be provided for each region. Interpolation is dense (all individual years included).
parameters.Description: System-wide discount rate in region r for each time-period.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The discount rate is taken into consideration when constructing the objective function discounting multiplier (OBJ_DISC), which is applied in each components of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR, EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJFIX, EQ_OBJSALV, EQ_OBJELS).

parameters.Name: G_DYEAR
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Year [BOTIME,EOTIME]; default value = M(MIYR_1), i.e. the first milestone year
parameters.Description: Base year for discounting.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The year to which all costs are to be discounted is taken into consideration when constructing the objective function discounting multiplier (OBJ_DISC), which is applied in each of the components of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR, EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJFIX, EQ_OBJSALV, EQ_OBJELS).

parameters.Name: G_RFRIR
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction (0,1]; default value = none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Optional parameter. If value is not provided, G_DRATE is assumed as the risk-free rate. By providing G_RFRIR, the technology-specific risk premiums can be kept unchanged over any sensitivity analyses with different G_DRATE values.
parameters.Description: Risk-free real interest rate in region r for each time-period. Provides the reference rate for NCAP_DRATE, such that the risk premium will be calculated against the risk-free rate.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The rate is taken into consideration when constructing the objective function coefficients for investment costs. EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJSALV

parameters.Name: G_ILEDNO
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,1]; default value: 0.1
parameters.Details/Notes: Only provided when the costs associated with the lead-time for new capacity (NCAP_ILED) are not to be included in the objective function. Not taken into account if the OBLONG switch or any alternative objective formulation is used.
parameters.Description: If the ratio of lead-time (NCAP_ILED) to the period duration (D) is below this threshold then the lead-time consideration will be ignored in the objective function
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Prevents the investment costs associated with investment lead-times from energy the investment component of the objective function (EQ_OBJINV).

parameters.Name: G_NOINTERP
parameters.Related Sets/Parameters: All parameters that are normally subjected to interpolation / extrapolation
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Binary indicator [0 or 1]; default value = 0
parameters.Details/Notes: Only provide when interpolation / extrapolation is to be turned off for all parameters. Interpolation of cost parameters is always done.
parameters.Description: Switch for generally turning-on (= 0 ) and turning-off (= 1 ) sparse inter- / extrapolation.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: G_OFFTHD
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Scalar [0,1]; Default value: 0; Default i/e: 5
parameters.Details/Notes: Setting G_OFFTHD=1 will make the *_OFF attributes effective only for periods fully included in the OFF range specified.
parameters.Description: Threshold for considering an *_OFF attribute disabling a process/commodity variable in period.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Affects availability of VAR_NCAP, VAR_ACT, VAR_FLO, VAR_COMNET/PRD

parameters.Name: G_OVERLAP
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Scalar [0,100]; Default value: TIMESTEP/2
parameters.Details/Notes: Used only when time-stepped solution is activated with the TIMESTEP control variable.
parameters.Description: Overlap of stepped solutions (in years).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: G_TLIFE
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Scalar [1,∞); default value = 10
parameters.Description: Default value for the technical lifetime of a process if not provided by the user.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: G_YRFR
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Fraction [0,1]; default value: none; only for the ANNUAL timeslice a value of 1 is predefined
parameters.Details/Notes: Must be provided for each region and timeslice.
parameters.Description: Duration of timeslice s as fraction of a year. Used for shaping the load curve and lining up timeslice duration for inter-regional exchanges.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to various variables (VAR_NCAP+PASTI, VAR_COMX, VAR_IRE, VAR_FLO, VAR_SIN/OUT) in the commodity balance equation (EQ(l)_COMBAL).

parameters.Name: IRE_BND
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Only applicable for inter-regional exchange processes (IRE). If the bound is specified for a timeslice (s) being above the commodity (c) timeslice resolution, the bound is applied to the sum of the imports/exports according to the timeslice tree. Standard aggregation.
parameters.Description: Bound on the total import (export) of commodity (c) from (to) region all_r in (out of) region r.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Controls the instances for which the trade bound constraint (EQ(l)_IREBND) is generated, and the RHS.

parameters.Name: IRE_CCVT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Scalar (0,∞); Default value: 1 if commodity names are the same in both regions; I/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: Required for mapping commodities involved in inter-regional exchanges between two regions whenever commodities traded are in different units in the regions.
parameters.Description: Conversion factor between commodity units in region r1 and region r2. Expresses the amount of commodity c2 in region r2 equivalent to 1 unit of commodity c1 in region r1.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The conversion factor is applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) in the inter-regional balance constraint (EQ_IRE). Similarly, applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) when an inter-regional exchange is bounded in the limit constraint (EQ(l)_IREBND). Similarly, applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) when an exchange with an external region is bounded (EQ(l)_XBND).

parameters.Name: IRE_FLO
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit c2/commodity unit c1 [0,∞); default value: 1; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Only applicable for inter-regional exchange processes (IRE) between two internal regions. Note that for each direction of trade a separate IRE_FLO needs to be specified. Similar to FLO_FUNC for standard processes. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Efficiency of exchange process from commodity c1 in region r1 to commodity c2 in the region2 in timeslice s2; the timeslice s2 refers to the r2 region.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the exchange flow variable (VAR_IRE) in the inter-regional trade equation (EQ_IRE). Applied to the exchange flow variable (VAR_IRE) when a bound on inter-regional trade is to be applied (EQ(l)_IREBND).

parameters.Name: IRE_FLOSUM
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit c2/commodity unit c1 [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Only applicable for inter-regional exchange processes (IRE). Since the efficiency IRE_FLO can only be used for exchange between internal regions, IRE_FLOSUM may be used to define an efficiency for an import/export with an external region by specifying the same commodity for c1 and c2 and the value 1-efficiency as auxiliary consumption. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Auxiliary consumption (io = IN, owing to the commodity entering the process) or production/ emission (io = OUT, owing to the commodity leaving the process) of commodity c2 due to the IMPort / EXPort (index ie) of the commodity c1 in region r
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The multiplier is applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) associated with an inter-regional exchange in the commodity balance constraint (EQ(l)_COMBAL). If a flow share (FLO_SHAR) is provided for an inter-regional exchange process then the multiplier is applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) in the share constraint (EQ(l)_IN/OUTSHR). If a cost is provided for the flow (FLO_COST or FLO_DELIV) then the factor is applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) in the variable component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: IRE_PRICE
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit / commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Only applicable for inter-regional exchange processes (IRE). Ignored if all_r is an internal region. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: IMPort/EXPort price (index ie) for to/from an internal region of a commodity (c) originating from/heading to an external region all_r.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The price of the exchange commodity is applied to the trade flow variable (VAR_IRE) in the variable costs component of the objective function (EQ_OBJVAR).

parameters.Name: IRE_TSCVT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Scalar (0,∞); default value: 1 if timeslice tree and names are the same in both regions; I/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: Used for mapping timeslices in different regions. Required if timeslice definitions are different in the regions.
parameters.Description: Matrix for mapping timeslices; the value for (r1,s1,r2,s2) gives the fraction of timeslice s2 in region r2 that falls in timeslice s1 in region r1.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The conversion factor is applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) in the inter-regional balance constraint (EQ_IRE). Similarly, applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) when an inter-regional exchange is bounded in the limit constraint (EQ(l)_IREBND). Similarly, applied to the flow variable (VAR_IRE) when an exchange with an external region is bounded (EQ(l)_XBND).

parameters.Name: IRE_XBND
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Only applicable for inter-regional exchange processes (IRE). Provide whenever a trade flow is to be constrained. Note that the limit is either imposed by summing lower or splitting higher flow variables (VAR_IRE) when specified at other than the actual flow level (as determined by the commodity and process levels (COM_TSL/ PRC_TSL )).
parameters.Description: Bound on the total IMPort (EXPort) (index ie) of commodity c in region all_r with all sources (destinations).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The trade limit equation EQ(l)_XBND generated either sums lower flow variables (VAR_IRE) or splits (according to the timeslice tree) coarser variables.

parameters.Name: MULTI
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Scalar [open]; default value: none; I/e: Full dense interpolation and extrapolation
parameters.Details/Notes: Only provided when the related shaping parameters are to be used.
parameters.Description: Multiplier table used for any shaping parameters (*_*M) to adjust the corresponding technical data as function of the year; the table contains different multiplier curves identified by the index j.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_AF
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,1]; default value: 1; Default i/e: STD. Remark: In special cases values >1 can also be used (when PRC_CAPACT does not represent the max. technical level of activity per unit of capacity).
parameters.Details/Notes: NCAP_AF, NCAP_AFA and NCAP_AFS can be applied simultaneously. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation. (Important remark: No inheritance/aggregation if any value is specified at process timeslices.)
parameters.Description: Availability factor relating a unit of production (process activity) in timeslice s to the current installed capacity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The corresponding capacity-activity constraint (EQ(l)_CAPACT) will be generated for any timeslice s. If the process timeslice level (PRC_TSL) is below said level, the activity variables will be summed.

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFA
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,1]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD. Remark: In special cases values >1 can also be used (when PRC_CAPACT has been chosen not to represent the max. technical level of activity per unit of capacity).
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when ‘ANNUAL’ level process operation is to be controlled. NCAP_AF, NCAP_AFA and NCAP_AFS can be applied simultaneously. NCAP_AFA is always assumed to be non-vintage dependent, even if the process is defined as a vintaged one; for vintage dependent annual availability NCAP_AFS with s=’ANNUAL’ can be used.
parameters.Description: Annual availability factor relating the annual activity of a process to the installed capacity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The corresponding capacity-activity constraint (EQ(l)_CAPACT) will be generated for the ‘ANNUAL’ timeslice. If the process timeslice level (PRC_TSL) is below said level, the activity variables will be summed.

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFC
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: If the commodities are in the PCG, constraint is applied to the flows in the PCG as a whole (linear combination of flows). Independent equations are generated for commodities not in the PCG, or when NCAP_AFC(r,’0’,p,’ACT’,tsl) =–1 is also specified.
parameters.Description: Commodity-specific availability of capacity for commodity group cg, at given timeslice level. Applies also matching NCAP_AF / AFS / AFA as a multiplier, unless the independent option is used.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Generates instances of EQ(l)_CAFLAC (thereby disabling EQ(l)_CAPACT generation), or EQL_CAPFLO.

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFCS
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: See NCAP_AFC. NCAP_AFCS is similar to NCAP_AFC but is defined on individual timeslices. Overrides NCAP_AFC.
parameters.Description: Commodity-specific availability of capacity for commodity group cg, timeslice-specific.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: See NCAP_AFC.

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFM
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer number; Default value: 0 (no multiplier applied); Default extrapolation: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when multiplication of NCAP_AF / NCAP_AFS based upon year is desired. Note: Multiplier index 1 is reserved for constant 1.
parameters.Description: Period sensitive multiplier curve (MULTI) to be applied to the availability factor parameters (NCAP_AF/AFA/AFS) of a process.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFS
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,1]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: NCAP_AF, NCAP_AFA and NCAP_AFS can be applied simultaneously. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation. (Important remark: No inheritance/aggregation if any value is specified at process timeslices.)
parameters.Description: Availability factor relating the activity of a process in a timeslice s being at or above the process timeslice level (prc_tsl) to the installed capacity. If for example the process timeslice level is ‘DAYNITE’ and NCAP_AFS is specified for timeslices on the ‘SEASONAL’ level, the sum of the ‘DAYNITE’ activities within a season are restricted, but not the ‘DAYNITE’ activities directly.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: The corresponding capacity-activity constraint (EQ(l)_CAPACT)

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFSX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer number; Default value: 0; Default extrapolation: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when shaping based upon age is desired.
parameters.Description: Age-based shaping curve (SHAPE) to be applied to the seasonal availability factor parameters (NCAP_AFS) of a process.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_AFX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer number; Default value: 0; Default extrapolation: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when shaping based upon age is desired.
parameters.Description: Age-based shaping curve (SHAPE) to be applied to the availability factor parameters (NCAP_AF/AFA/AFS) of a process.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_BND
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided for each process to have its overall installed capacity (VAR_NCAP) limited in a period.
parameters.Description: Bound on the permitted level on investment in new capacity
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Imposes an indirect limit on the capacity transfer equation (EQ_CPT) by means of a direct bound on the new investments capacity variable (VAR_NCAP).

parameters.Name: NCAP_BPME
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: The parameter is only taken into account when the process is of type CHP, and NCAP_CDME has been also defined.
parameters.Description: Back pressure mode efficiency (or total efficiency in full CHP mode).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Process transformation equation, either EQE_ACTEFF or EQ_PTRANS

parameters.Name: NCAP_CDME
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: The parameter can only be used for standard processes having electricity output in the PCG.
parameters.Description: Condensing mode efficiency
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Process transformation equation, either EQE_ACTEFF or EQ_PTRANS

parameters.Name: NCAP_CEH
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [–1,∞]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: The parameter is only taken into account when the process is defined to be of type CHP.
parameters.Description: Coefficient of electricity to heat along the iso-fuel line in a pass-out CHP technology.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Process transformation equation, either EQE_ACTEFF or EQ_PTRANS

parameters.Name: NCAP_CHPR
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,∞); default value: 1; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: The parameter is only taken into account when the process is defined to be of type CHP.
parameters.Description: Heat-to-power ratio of a CHP technology (fixed / minimum / maximum ratio). If no ratio equations should be generated, one can define any I/E value with lim='N'.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Activates the generation of output share equations, implemented with EQ(l)_OUTSHR

parameters.Name: NCAP_CLAG
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Years [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when there is a delay in commodity output after commissioning new capacity.
parameters.Description: Lagtime of a commodity after new capacity is installed.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) in the commodity balance (EQ(l)_COMBAL) of the investment period or previous periods.

parameters.Name: NCAP_CLED
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Years [open]; default value: = NCAP_ILED; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when a commodity must be available prior to availability of a process.
parameters.Description: Lead time requirement for a commodity during construction (NCAP_ICOM), prior to the initial availability of the capacity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) in the commodity balance (EQ(l)_COMBAL) of the investment period or previous periods.

parameters.Name: NCAP_COM
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit per capacity unit [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when the consumption or production of a commodity is tied to the level of the installed capacity.
parameters.Description: Emission (or land-use) of commodity c associated with the capacity of a process for each year said capacity exists.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the capacity variable (VAR_CAP) in the commodity balance (EQ_COMBAL).

parameters.Name: NCAP_COST
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided whenever there is a cost associated with putting new capacity in place.
parameters.Description: Investment costs of new installed capacity according to the installation year.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJINV). May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: NCAP_CPX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer number; Default value: 0; Default extrapolation: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when shaping based upon age is desired.
parameters.Description: Defines a shape index for shaping the capacity transfer coefficients by the age of each process vintage. As a result, the capacity will have a survival rate as a function of age.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Impacts all calculations that are dependent upon the availability of capacity (VAR_NCAP), most directly the capacity transfer (EQ_CPT), and capacity availability equations (EQ(l)_CAPACT).

parameters.Name: NCAP_DCOST
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when there are decommissioning costs associated with a process.
parameters.Description: Cost of dismantling a facility after the end of its lifetime.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the current capacity subject to decommissioning (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJNV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_DELIF
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Years (0,∞); default value: NCAP_DLIFE; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when the timeframe for paying for decommission is different from that of the actual decommissioning.
parameters.Description: Economic lifetime of the decommissioning activity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) when entering the salvage portion of the objective function (EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_DISC
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Used for lumpy investments.
parameters.Description: Size of capacity units that can be added.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the lumpy investment integer variable (VAR_DNCAP) in the discrete investment equation (EQ_DSCNCAP) to set the corresponding standard investment variable level (VAR_NCAP).

parameters.Name: NCAP_DLAG
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Years [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when there is a lag in the decommissioning of a process (e.g., to allow the nuclear core to reduce its radiation).
parameters.Description: Number of years delay before decommissioning can begin after the lifetime of a technology has ended.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Delay applied to a decommissioning flow (VAR_FLO) in the balance equation (EQ(l)_COMBAL) as production. Delay applied to the current capacity subject to decommissioning (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function components (EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJFIX, EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_DLAGC
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when there is a cost during any lag in the decommissioning (e.g., security).
parameters.Description: Cost occurring during the lag time after the technical lifetime of a process has ended and before its decommissioning starts.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Cost during delay applied to the current capacity subject to decommissioning (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function components (EQ_OBJFIX, EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_DLIFE
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Years (0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when a process has a decommissioning phase.
parameters.Description: Technical time for dismantling a facility after the end its technical lifetime, plus any lag time (NCAP_DLAG).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Decommissioning time impacting (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function components (EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_DRATE
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Percent (0,∞); default value: G_DRATE; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided if the cost of borrowing for a process is different from the standard discount rate.
parameters.Description: Technology specific discount rate.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Discount rate applied to investments (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function components (EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_ELIFE
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: years (0,∞); default value: NCAP_TLIFE; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided only when the economic lifetime differs from the technical lifetime (NCAP_TLIFE).
parameters.Description: Economic lifetime of a process.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Economic lifetime of a process when costing investment (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) or capacity in the objective function components (EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJSALV, EQ_OBJFIX).

parameters.Name: NCAP_FDR
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction (0,∞); default value:none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when the effect of functional depreciation is considered significant to justify accelerated decrease in salvage value.
parameters.Description: Defines an annual rate of additional depreciation in the salvage value.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Affects the salvage value coefficients in EQ_OBJSALV

parameters.Name: NCAP_FOM
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when there is a fixed cost associated with the installed capacity.
parameters.Description: Fixed operating and maintenance cost per unit of capacity according to the installation year.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Fixed operating and maintenance costs associated with total installed capacity (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function components (EQ_OBJFIX).

parameters.Name: NCAP_FOMM
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer number; Default value: 0; Default extrapolation: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when shaping based upon the period is desired.
parameters.Description: Period sensitive multiplier curve (MULTI) applied to the fixed operating and maintenance costs (NCAP_FOM).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_FOMX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer number; Default value: 0; Default extrapolation: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when shaping based upon age is desired.
parameters.Description: Age-based shaping curve (SHAPE) to be applied to the fixed operating and maintenance cost.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_FSUB
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit per capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when there is a subsidy for associated with the level of installed capacity.
parameters.Description: Subsidy per unit of installed capacity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Fixed subsidy associated with total installed capacity (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function component (EQ_OBJFIX) with a minus sign.

parameters.Name: NCAP_FSUBM
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer number; Default value: 0; Default extrapolation: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when shaping based upon the period is desired.
parameters.Description: Period sensitive multiplier curve (MULTI) applied to the subsidy (NCAP_FSUB).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_FSUBX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer number; Default value: 0; Default extrapolation: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when shaping based upon age is desired.
parameters.Description: Age-based shaping curve (SHAPE) to be applied to the fixed subsidy (NCAP_FSUB).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_FTAX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: monetary unit per capacity unit [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when there is a fixed tax based upon the level of the installed capacity.
parameters.Description: Tax per unit of installed capacity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Fixed tax associated with total installed capacity (VAR_NCAP+NCAP_PASTI) when entering the objective function components (EQ_OBJFIX).

parameters.Name: NCAP_FTAXM
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer number; Default value: 0; Default extrapolation: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when shaping based upon the period is desired.
parameters.Description: Period sensitive multiplier curve (MULTI) applied to the tax (NCAP_FTAX).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_FTAXX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer number; Default value: 0; Default extrapolation: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when shaping based upon age is desired.
parameters.Description: Age-based shaping curve (SHAPE) to be applied to the fixed tax (NCAP_FTAX).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: NCAP_ICOM
