parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit per capacity unit [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when a commodity is needed in the period in which the new capacity is to be available,
parameters.Description: Amount of commodity (c) required for the construction of new capacity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) in the appropriate commodity balance constraints (EQ(l)_COMBAL).

parameters.Name: NCAP_ILED
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Years [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when there is a delay between when the investment decision occurs and when the capacity (new capacity or past investment) is initially available.
parameters.Description: Lead time between investment decision and actual availability of new capacity (= construction time).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) balance constraints (EQ(l)_COMBAL) as part of consumption, if there is an associated flow (NCAP_ICOM). Used as to distinguish between small and large investments (VAR_NCAP) and thus influences the way the investment and fixed costs are treated in the objective function (EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJFIX, EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_ISPCT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction (−∞,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when defining an investment subsidy in proportion to the investment cost. Requires that NCAP_COST is defined.
parameters.Description: Unit investment subsidy as a fraction of unit investment costs, in the same currency unit, per unit of new capacity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJINV) with a minus sign.

parameters.Name: NCAP_ISUB
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: monetary unit per capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when there is a subsidy for new investments in a period.
parameters.Description: Subsidy per unit of new installed capacity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJINV) with a minus sign. May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: NCAP_ITAX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: monetary unit per capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when there is a tax associated with new investments in a period.
parameters.Description: Tax per unit of new installed capacity
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) when entering the objective function (EQ_OBJNV). May appear in user constraints (EQ_UC*) if specified in UC_NAME.

parameters.Name: NCAP_MSPRF
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Unit: dimensionless (0,∞); Default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Optional parameter for the logit market sharing mechanism, for process p supplying market c.
parameters.Description: In the logit market sharing mechanism, defines preference weights (lim='N') and intangible costs (lim='LO')
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_MSNCAPB

parameters.Name: NCAP_OCOM
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit per capacity unit [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when there is a commodity release associated with the decommissioning.
parameters.Description: Amount of commodity c per unit of capacity released during the dismantling of a process.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) in the appropriate commodity constraints (EQ(l)_COMBAL) as part of production in the appropriate period.

parameters.Name: NCAP_OLIFE
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Years (0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Requires that early retirements are enabled and the process is vintaged.
parameters.Description: Maximum operating lifetime of a process, in terms of full-load years.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQL_SCAP

parameters.Name: NCAP_PASTI
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Past investment can also be specified for milestone years, e.g. if the milestone year is a historic year, so that capacity additions are known or if planned future investments are already known.
parameters.Description: Investment in new capacity made before the beginning of the model horizon (in the year specified by pastyear).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_COMBAL, EQ_CPT, EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJSALV, EQ_OBJFIX

parameters.Name: NCAP_PASTY
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Years [1,999]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided to spread a single past investment (NCAP_PASTI) back over several years (e.g., cars in the period before the 1st milestoneyr were bought over the previous 15 years). If overlaps with other past investments, the capacity values are added.
parameters.Description: Number of years to go back to calculate a linear build-up of past investments
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: {See NCAP_PASTI}

parameters.Name: NCAP_PKCNT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,1]; default value: 1; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: If the indicator PRC_PKAF is specified, the NCAP_PKCNT is set equal to the availabilities NCAP_AF. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Fraction of capacity that can contribute to peaking equations.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to investments in capacity (VAR_NCAP, NCAP_PASTI) in the peaking constraint (EQ_PEAK).

parameters.Name: NCAP_SEMI
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity unit (0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Upper bound for the capacity must be defined by NCAP_BND; if not defined, assumed to be equal to the lower bound. Requires MIP.
parameters.Description: Semi-continuous new capacity, lower bound. (See Section 5.9)
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the semi-continuous investment variable VAR_SNCAP in the discrete investment equation EQ_DSCNCAP

parameters.Name: NCAP_START
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Year [1000, ∞); default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: NCAP_START(r,p)=y is equivalent to PRC_NOFF(r,p,BOH,y–1).
parameters.Description: Start year for new investments
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Affects the availability of investment variable (VAR_NCAP)

parameters.Name: NCAP_TLIFE
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Years (0,∞); default value: G_TLIFE; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Expected for all technologies that have investment costs. Values below 0.5 cannot be well accounted in the objective function, and should thus be avoided (they are automatically resetted to 1).
parameters.Description: Technical lifetime of a process.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Impacts all calculations that are dependent upon the availability of investments (VAR_NCAP) including capacity transfer (EQ_CPT), commodity flow (EQ(l)_COMBAL), costs (EQ_OBJINV, EQ_OBJFIX, EQ_OBJVAR, EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: NCAP_VALU
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit / commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when a released commodity has a value.
parameters.Description: Value of a commodity released at decommissioning (NCAP_OCOM).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the investment related (VAR_NCAP, NCAP_PASTI) release flow at decommissioning in the objective function (EQ_OBJSALV).

parameters.Name: PRC_ACTFLO
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit / activity unit (0,∞); default value: 1; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Only (rarely) provided when either the activity and flow variables of a process are in different units, or if there is a conversion efficiency between the activity and the flow(s) in the PCG. The group (cg) can be the whole PCG or any individual commodity in the PCG, or 'ACT' (=PCG).
parameters.Description: 1) Conversion factor from units of activity to units of those flow variables that define the activity (primary commodity group), or, 2) Conversion multiplier representing the amount of flow(s) in the cg per 1 unit of activity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the primary commodity (prc_pcg) flow variables (VAR_FLO, VAR_IRE) to relate overall activity (VAR_ACT in EQ_ACTFLO). When the Reduction algorithm activated it is applied to the activity variable (VAR_ACT) in those cases where the flow variable (VAR_FLO) can be replaced by the activity variable (e.g. the activity is defined by one commodity flow).

parameters.Name: PRC_CAPACT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Activity unit / capacity unit (0,∞); default value: 1; Default i/e: none
parameters.Description: Conversion factor from capacity unit to activity unit assuming that the capacity is used for one year.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied along with the availability factor (NCAP_AF) to the investment (VAR_NCAP + NCAP_PASTI) in the utilization equations (EQ(l)_CAPACT, EQ(l)_CAFLAC). Applied to the investment (VAR_NCAP + NCAP_PASTI) in the peak constraint (EQ_PEAK). Applied to the investment (VAR_NCAP + NCAP_PASTI) in the capacity utilization constraint for CHP plants (ECT_AFCHP) and peak constraint in the IER extension (see Part III).

parameters.Name: PRC_GMAP
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Dimensionless (∞,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided when process groupings are needed for custom processing e.g. in a TIMES code extension.
parameters.Description: User-defined grouping of processes by group indicator item.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: None

parameters.Name: PRC_MARK
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Combined limit on commodity production is derived as the sum of the process-specific productions multiplied by the inverse values of PRC_MARK. The constraint is applied to the annual production of commodity. Item can be any desired label identifying the group.
parameters.Description: Process group-wise market share, which defines a constraint for the combined market share of multiple processes in the total commodity production.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_FLOMRK, VAR_COMPRD

parameters.Name: PRC_REFIT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Dimensionless [–3,3]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Requires that early retirements are allowed in the model. The parameter value determines the type of the refurbishment option
parameters.Description: Defines a mapping of host process prc to a retrofit or lifetime extension option p in region r, where p is another process representing the refurbishment option. The value of the parameter determines the type of the refurbishment option (see column on the left).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Activates generation of the retrofit / lifetime extension equations (EQL_REFIT)

parameters.Name: PRC_RESID
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: 1
parameters.Details/Notes: If only a single data point is specified, linear decay of the specified residual capacity over technical lifetime is assumed. Used as an alternative to NCAP_PASTI, not to use both for the same process.
parameters.Description: Residual existing capacity stock of process (p) still available in the year specified (datayear). PRC_RESID is most useful for describing the stock of capacity with mixed vintages, while NCAP_PASTI is suited for capacities of a certain vintages, such as an individual power plants.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_CAPACT, EQ(l)_CAFLAC, EQL_CAPFLO, EQ(l)_CPT, VAR_CAP

parameters.Name: R_CUREX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Scalar (0,∞); Default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: The target currency cur2 must have a discount rate defined with G_DRATE.
parameters.Description: Conversion factor from currency cur1 to currency cur2 in region r, in order to use cur2 in the objective function.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Affects cost coefficients in EQ_OBJ

parameters.Name: RCAP_BLK
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Only effective when lumpy early capacity retirements are active (RETIRE=MIP). Requires MIP.
parameters.Description: Retirement block size.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_DSCRET, VAR_DRCAP, VAR_SCAP

parameters.Name: RCAP_BND
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Unless the control variable DSCAUTO=YES, requires that PRC_RCAP is defined for process p.
parameters.Description: Bound on the retired amount of capacity in a period (same bound for all vintages).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: VAR_RCAP, VAR_SCAP

parameters.Name: REG_BDNCAP
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Year [1000, ∞); default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Only taken into account when a previous solution is loaded by using the LPOINT control variable. If several bound types are specified, one can use NCAP_BND(r,'0',p,'N')=±1 for assigning only an UP/LO bound for any process p.
parameters.Description: Defines the year up to which capacities are to be bounded by previous solution, by model region. One can choose FX/UP/LO bounds, as well as lower bounds only for selected processes.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: VAR_NCAP

parameters.Name: REG_BNDCST
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: The cost aggregations (agg) supported are listed in the set COSTAGG (see Table 1).
parameters.Description: Bound on regional costs by type of cost aggregation.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BNDCST, VAR_CUMCST

parameters.Name: REG_CUMCST
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: The cost aggregations (agg) supported are listed in the set COSTAGG (see Table 1).
parameters.Description: Cumulative bound on regional costs by type of cost aggregation.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_BNDCST, VAR_CUMCST

parameters.Name: REG_FIXT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Year [1000, ∞); default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Only taken into account when the first periods are fixed by using the FIXBOH control variable.
parameters.Description: Defines the year up to which periods are fixed to previous solution, by region–
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: RPT_OPT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer value [open]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: See Part III, Table 15 for a list and descriptions of available options.
parameters.Description: Miscellaneous reporting options
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: none

parameters.Name: SHAPE
parameters.Related Sets/Parameters: FLO_FUNCX, FLO_SUMX, NCAP_AFX, NCAP_FOMX, NCAP_FSUBX, NCAP_FTAXX
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Scalar [open]; default value: none; I/e: Full dense interpolation
parameters.Details/Notes: Provided for each age dependent shaping curve that is to be applied.
parameters.Description: Multiplier table used for any shaping parameters (*_*X) to adjust the corresponding technical data as function of the age;
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: {See Related Parameters}

parameters.Name: STG_CHRG
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Storage unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Only applicable to storage processes (STG): timeslice storage, inter-period storage or night storage devices.
parameters.Description: Annual exogenous charging of a storage technology in a particular timeslice s.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Exogenous charging of storage enters storage equations (EQ_STGTSS, EQ_STGIPS) as right-hand side constant.

parameters.Name: STG_EFF
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,∞); default value: 1; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Only applicable to storage processes (STG): timeslice storage, inter-period storage or night storage devices.
parameters.Description: Efficiency of storage process.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Applied to the storage output flow (VAR_SOUT) in the commodity balance (EQ(l)_COMBAL) for the stored commodity.

parameters.Name: STG_LOSS
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Only applicable to storage processes (STG): timeslice storage, inter-period storage or night storage devices.
parameters.Description: STG_LOSS>0 defines the loss in proportion to the initial storage level during one year’s storage time. STG_LOSS<0 defines an equilibrium loss, i.e. how much the annual losses would be if the storage level is kept constant. Annual loss of a storage process per unit of average energy stored.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Timeslice storage process (EQ_STGTSS): applied to the average storage level (VAR_ACT) between two consecutive timeslices. Inter-period storage process (EQ_STGIPS): applied to the average storage level from the pre-period (VAR_ACT) and the net inflow (VAR_SIN-VAR_SOUT) of the current period.

parameters.Name: STG_MAXCYC
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Number of cycles [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Can only be used for genuine storage processes. The limit can be exceeded by paying for additional replacement capacity, with a penalty cost equal to the investment annuity.
parameters.Description: Defines the maximum number of storage cycles over the lifetime. Sets a limit for the total discharge divided by storage capacity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Activates generation of the cycle limit/penalty equations (EQL_STGCCL).

parameters.Name: STG_SIFT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Can only be used for a timeslice storage process.
parameters.Description: Defines process prc as a load-shifting process, and limits the load shifting of demand com in timeslice ts to at most the fraction specified by the parameter value.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Activates generation of load shifting constraints (EQ(l)_SLSIFT).

parameters.Name: STGIN_BND
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Only applicable to storage processes (STG): timeslice storage, inter-period storage or night storage devices.
parameters.Description: Bound on the input flow of a storage process in a timeslice s.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Storage input bound constraint (EQ(l)_STGIN) when s is above prc_tsl of the storage process. Direct bound on storage input flow (VAR_SIN) when at the prc_tsl level.

parameters.Name: STGOUT_BND
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity unit [0,∞); default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Only applicable to storage processes (STG): timeslice storage, inter-period storage or night storage devices.
parameters.Description: Bound on the output flow of a storage process in a timeslice s.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Storage output bound constraint (EQ(l)_STGOUT) when s is above prc_tsl of the storage process. Direct bound on storage output flow variable (VAR_SOUT) when at the prc_tsl level.

parameters.Name: TL_CCAP0
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity unit [open]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Requires using ETL. For learning technologies teg when ETL is used.
parameters.Description: Initial cumulative capacity of a learning technology.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Cumulative investment constraint (EQ_CUINV) and cumulative capacity variable (VAR_CCAP) in endogenous technological learning formulation.

parameters.Name: TL_CCAPM
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity unit [open]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Requires using ETL. For learning technologies teg when ETL is used.
parameters.Description: Maximum cumulative capacity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Core ETL equations.

parameters.Name: TL_CLUSTER
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0-1]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Requires using ETL (MIP). Provided to model clustered endogenous technology learning. Each of the learning parameters must also be specified for the key learning technology.
parameters.Description: Indicator that a technology (teg) is a learning component that is part of another technology (prc) in region r; teg is also called key component.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_CLU

parameters.Name: TL_MRCLUST
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Decimal fraction [0-1]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Requires using ETL (MIP).
parameters.Description: Mapping for multi-region clustering between learning key components (teg) and processes (p) that utilize the key component.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_MRCLU

parameters.Name: TL_PRAT
parameters.Related Sets/Parameters: (Alias: PRAT), ALPH, BETA, CCAPK, CCOST0, PAT, PBT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Scalar [0,1]; default value none
parameters.Details/Notes: Requires using ETL. Provided for learning technologies (teg) when ETL is used.
parameters.Description: Progress ratio indicating the drop in the investment cost each time there is a doubling of the installed capacity.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Fundamental factor to describe the learning curve and thus effects nearly all equations and variables related to endogenous technology learning (ETL).

parameters.Name: TL_SC0
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Monetary unit / capacity unit [open]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Requires using ETL. For learning technologies teg when ETL is used.
parameters.Description: Initial specific investment costs.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Defines together with CCAP0 initial point of learning curve and affects thus the core equations and variables of endogenous technological learning (ETL).

parameters.Name: TL_SEG
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Integer [1-6]; default value: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Requires using ETL. For learning technologies teg when ETL is used.
parameters.Description: Number of segments.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Influences the piecewise linear approximation of the cumulative cost curve (EQ_COS, EQ_LA1, EQ_LA2).

parameters.Name: TS_CYCLE
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Number of days [1,∞); Default values: 365 for ts=ANNUAL, 7 for any ts above the WEEKLY level, 1 for any ts above the DAYNITE level
parameters.Details/Notes: Recommended to be used whenever timeslice cycles are different from the default, instead of changing G_CYCLE.
parameters.Description: Defines the length of the timeslice cycles under timeslice ts, in days, and thereby also the number of timeslice cycles under each parent.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Affects the calculation of actual timeslice lengths and number of timeslice cycles in various equations, notably storage and dispatching equations.

parameters.Name: UC_ACT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: None [open]; default value: none; Default: i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Coefficient of the activity variable VAR_ACT in a user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_UCXXX

parameters.Name: UC_CAP
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: None [open]; default value: none; Default: i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints.
parameters.Description: Coefficient of the activity variable VAR_CAP in a user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_UCXXX

parameters.Name: UC_CLI
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Dimensionless [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints. Climate variable can be at least any of CO2-GTC, CO2-ATM, CO2-UP, CO2-LO, FORCING, DELTA-ATM, DELTA-LO (for carbon). See Appendix on Climate Module for details.
parameters.Description: Multiplier of climate variable in user constraint
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_UCXXX

parameters.Name: UC_COMCON
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: None [open]; default value: none; Default: i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints. No inheritance/aggregation (might be changed in the future).
parameters.Description: Coefficient of the commodity consumption variable VAR_COMCON in a user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_UCXXX

parameters.Name: UC_COMNET
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: None [open]; default value: none; Default: i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints. No inheritance/aggregation (might be changed in the future).
parameters.Description: Coefficient of the net commodity production variable VAR_COMNET in a user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_UCXXX

parameters.Name: UC_COMPRD
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: None [open]; default value: none; Default: i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints. No inheritance/aggregation (might be changed in the future).
parameters.Description: Coefficient of the total commodity production variable VAR_COMPRD in a user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_UCXXX

parameters.Name: UC_CUMACT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Dimensionless [open]; default value: none; I/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in cumulative user constraints only.
parameters.Description: Multiplier of cumulative process activity variable in user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_UC, EQ(l)_UCR, VAR_CUMFLO

parameters.Name: UC_CUMCOM
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Dimensionless [open]; default value: none; I/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in cumulative user constraints only. Type=NET/PRD determines the variable referred to (CUMNET/ CUMPRD).
parameters.Description: Multiplier of cumulative commodity variable in user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_UC, EQ(l)_UCR, VAR_CUMCOM

parameters.Name: UC_CUMFLO
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Dimensionless [open]; default value: none; I/e: N/A
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in cumulative user constraints only.
parameters.Description: Multiplier of cumulative process flow variable in user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_UC, EQ(l)_UCR, VAR_CUMFLO

parameters.Name: UC_FLO
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: None [open]; default value: none; Default: i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Coefficient of the flow VAR_FLO variable in a user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_UCXXX

parameters.Name: UC_IRE
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: None [open]; default value: none; Default: i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints. Direct inheritance. Weighted aggregation.
parameters.Description: Coefficient of the trade variable VAR_IRE in a user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_UCXXX

parameters.Name: UC_NCAP
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: None [open]; default value: none; Default: i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints.
parameters.Description: Coefficient of the investment variable VAR_NCAP in a user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_UCXXX

parameters.Name: UC_RHS
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: None [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints.
parameters.Description: RHS constant with bound type of bd (lim) of a user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: RHS (right-hand side) constant of a user constraint, which is summing over regions (uc_r_sum), periods (uc_t_sum) and timeslices (uc_ts_sum) (EQ(l)_UC).

parameters.Name: UC_RHSR
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: None [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: none
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints.
parameters.Description: RHS constant with bound type of bd (lim) of a user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: RHS constant of user constraints, which are generated for each region (uc_r_each) and are summing over periods (uc_t_sum) and timeslices (uc_ts_sum) (EQ(l)_UCR).

parameters.Name: UC_RHSRT
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: None [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints.
parameters.Description: RHS constant with bound type of bd (lim) of a user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: RHS constant of user constraints, which are generated for each region (uc_r_each) and period (uc_t_each) and are summing over timeslices (uc_ts_sum) (EQ(l)_UCRT). If dynamic, constraints will be generated between two successive periods (EQ(l)_UCRSU).

parameters.Name: UC_RHSRTS
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: None [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints. No inheritance / aggregation, unless the target timeslice level is specified by UC_TSL.
parameters.Description: RHS constant with bound type of bd (lim) of a user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: RHS constant of user constraints, which are generated for each specified region (uc_r_each), period (uc_t_each) and timeslice (uc_ts_each) (EQ(l)_UCRTS). If dynamic, constraints will be generated between two successive periods (EQ(l)_UCRSUS).

parameters.Name: UC_RHST
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: None [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints.
parameters.Description: RHS constant with bound type of bd (lim) of a user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: RHS constant of user constraints, which are generated for each specified period (uc_t_each) and are summing over regions (uc_r_sum) and timeslices (uc_ts_sum) (EQ(l)_UCT). If dynamic, constraints will be generated between two successive periods (EQ(l)_UCSU).

parameters.Name: UC_RHSTS
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: None [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: MIG
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints. No inheritance/aggregation. Binding user constraints are defined using bound types lim=UP/LO/FX. Non-binding (free) user constraints can be defined using the lim type lim=N.
parameters.Description: RHS constant with bound type of bd (lim) of a user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: RHS constant of user constraints, which are generated for each period (uc_t_each) and timeslice (uc_ts_each) and are summing over regions (uc_r_sum) (EQ(l)_UCTS). If dynamic, constraints will be generated between two successive periods (EQ(l)_UCSUS).

parameters.Name: UC_TIME
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Dimensionless [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Used in user constraints.
parameters.Description: Multiplier for the number of years in model periods (static UCs), or between milestone years (dynamic UCs)
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: Adds a time constant to the RHS side. EQ(l)_UCXXX

parameters.Name: UC_UCN
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Dimensionless [open]; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Only taken into account if the user constraint is by region & period, and summing over timeslices and the RHS side is activated (EQ(l)_UCRSU).
parameters.Description: Multiplier of user constraint variable in another user constraint.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_UCRSU, VAR_UCRT

parameters.Name: VDA_EMCB
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Emission units per flow units; default value: none; Default i/e: STD
parameters.Details/Notes: Available in the VEDA shell. Any process-specific FLO_EMIS / FLO_EFF with the commodities c and com will override VDA_EMCB.
parameters.Description: Emissions (com) from the combustion of commodity (c) in region (r).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_PTRANS

parameters.Name: ALPH
parameters.Instances: For learning technologies teg when ETL is used.
parameters.Description: Axis intercept on cumulative cost axis for description of linear equation valid for segment kp.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_COS

parameters.Name: BETA
parameters.Instances: For learning technologies teg when ETL is used.
parameters.Description: Slope of cumulative cost curve in segment kp ( = specific investment cost).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_COS

parameters.Name: CCAPK
parameters.Instances: For learning technologies teg when ETL is used.
parameters.Description: Cumulative capacity at kinkpoint kp.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_LA1, EQ_LA2

parameters.Name: CCOSTK
parameters.Instances: For learning technologies teg when ETL is used.
parameters.Description: Cumulative investment cost at kinkpoint kp.

parameters.Name: CCOSTM
parameters.Instances: For learning technologies teg when ETL is used.
parameters.Description: Maximum cumulative cost based on CCAPM.

parameters.Name: COEF_AF
parameters.Instances: For each technology, at the level of process operation (PRC_TSL).
parameters.Description: Availability coefficient of the capacity (new investment variable VAR_NCAP plus still existing past investments NCAP_PASTI) in EQ(l)_CAPACT; COEF_AF is derived from the availability input parameters NCAP_AF, NCAP_AFA and NCAP_AFS taking into account any specified MULTI or SHAPE multipliers.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_CAPACT

parameters.Name: COEF_CPT
parameters.Instances: For each technology the amount of an investment (VAR_NCAP) available in the period.
parameters.Description: Fraction of capacity built in period v that is available in period t; might be smaller than 1 due to NCAP_ILED in vintage period or the fact that the lifetime ends within a period.
parameters.Related Sets/Parameters: NCAP_ILED, NCAP_TLIFE, D, B, E, M
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_CPT, EQ_OBJINV

parameters.Name: COEF_ICOM
parameters.Instances: Whenever there is a commodity required during construction, the consuming being taken from the balance constraint (EQ(l)_COMBAL). Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) of period v in the commodity balance (EQ(l)_COMBAL) of period t. The duration during which the commodity is produced starts in the year B(v)+NCAP_ILED(v)–NCAP_CLED(v) and ends in the year B(v)+NCAP_ILED(v)–1.
parameters.Description: Coefficient for commodity requirement during construction in period t due to investment decision in period v (see also NCAP_ICOM).
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_COMBAL

parameters.Name: COEF_OCOM
parameters.Instances: Whenever there is a commodity released during decommissioning, the production being added to the balance constraint (EQ(l)_COMBAL). Applied to the investment variable (VAR_NCAP) of period v in the commodity balance (EQ(l)_COMBAL) of period t. The release occurs during the decommissioning lifetime NCAP_DLIFE.
parameters.Description: Coefficient for commodity release during decommissioning time in period t due to investment made in period v.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ(l)_COMBAL, EQ_OBJSALV

parameters.Name: COEF_PTRAN
parameters.Instances: For each flow through a process.
parameters.Description: Coefficient of flow variable of commodity c belonging to commodity group cg in EQ_PTRANS equation between the commodity groups cg and com_grp.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_PTRANS

parameters.Name: COEF_PVT
parameters.Instances: For each region, the present value of the time in each period.
parameters.Description: Coefficient for the present value of periods, used primarily for undiscounting the solution marginals.

parameters.Name: COEF_RPTI
parameters.Instances: For each technology whose technical life (NCAP_TLIFE) is shorter than the period.
parameters.Description: Number of repeated investment of process p in period v when the technical lifetime minus the construction time is shorter than the period duration; Rounded to the next largest integer number.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_OBJINV

parameters.Name: COR_SALVD
parameters.Instances: For each technology existing past the end of the modelling horizon with decommissioning costs, adjustment in the objective function.
parameters.Description: Correction factor for decommissioning costs taking into account technical discount rates and economic decommissioning times.
parameters.Related Sets/Parameters: NCAP_DRATE, G_DRATE, NCAP_DELIF, NCAP_DLIFE, D, M
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_OBJSALV

parameters.Name: COR_SALVI
parameters.Instances: For each process extending past the end of the modelling horizon adjustment in the objective function.
parameters.Description: Correction factor for investment costs taking into account technical discount rates, economic lifetimes and a user-defined discount shift (triggered by the control switch MIDYEAR (see Section 6.2 EQ_OBJ)).
parameters.Related Sets/Parameters: NCAP_DRATE, G_DRATE, NCAP_ELIFE, D, M, MIDYEAR
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_OBJSALV

parameters.Name: D
parameters.Instances: For each period, D(t) = E(t)–B(t)+1.
parameters.Description: Duration of period t.

parameters.Name: DUR_MAX
parameters.Instances: For the model.
parameters.Description: Maximum of NCAP_ILED + NCAP_TLIFE + NCAP_DLAG + NCAP_DLIFE + NCAP_DELIF over all regions, periods and processes.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: eachyear

parameters.Name: LEAD
parameters.Instances: For each milestone year.
parameters.Description: Time between milestone years t–1 and t, in years. For the first milestone year t1, LEAD(t1)=M(t1)–B(t1)+1.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: BUILDUP modifier

parameters.Name: M
parameters.Instances: For each period, if the duration of the period is even, the middle year of the period is B(t) + D(t)/2 – 1, if the period is uneven, the middle year is B(t) + [D(t)/2 – 0.5].
parameters.Description: Middle year of period t.

parameters.Name: MINYR
parameters.Instances: For the model
parameters.Description: Minimum year over t = M(t) – D(t) +1; used in objective function.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: eachyear, eohyears, EQ_OBJ

parameters.Name: MIYR_V1
parameters.Instances: For the model
parameters.Description: First year of model horizon.

parameters.Name: MIYR_VL
parameters.Instances: For the model
parameters.Description: Last year of model horizon.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: eachyear, eohyears

parameters.Name: NTCHTEG
parameters.Instances: For learning technologies teg when ETL with technology clusters is used.
parameters.Description: Number of processes using the same key technology teg.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: EQ_CLU

parameters.Name: PAT
parameters.Description: The internal parameter PAT describes the specific investment costs of the first unit. It is derived in COEF_ETL.ETL using PBT, SC0 and CCAP0. PAT does not occur directly in the equations, but is used in the calculation of equation coefficients.

parameters.Name: PBT
parameters.Description: The learning index PBT is an internal parameter calculated in COEF_ETL.ETL. It is derived from the progress ratio PRAT using the formula: PBT(r,p) = -log(PRAT(r,p))/log(2). PBT does not occur directly in the equations, but is used in the calculation of equation coefficients.

parameters.Name: PYR_V1
parameters.Instances: For the model
parameters.Description: Minimum of pastyears and MINYR.

parameters.Name: SALV_DEC
parameters.Instances: For those technologies with salvage costs incurred after the model horizon the contribution to the objective function.
parameters.Description: Salvage proportion of decommissioning costs made at period v with commissioning year k.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: SALVDECOM

parameters.Name: SALV_INV
parameters.Instances: For those technologies with salvage costs incurred after the model horizon the contribution to the objective function.
parameters.Description: Salvage proportion of investment made at period v with commissioning year k.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: SALVINV

parameters.Name: SALVSURV
parameters.Instances: For those technologies with surveillance costs incurred after the model horizon the contribution to the objective function.
parameters.Description: Salvage proportion of surveillance costs made at period v with commissioning year k.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: SALVSURV

parameters.Name: SHAPE_CPT
parameters.Description: Age-dependent SHAPE multiplier of the parameter COEF_CPT.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: COEF_CPT

parameters.Name: SHAPE_FOM
parameters.Description: Age-dependent SHAPE multiplier of the parameter NCAP_FOM.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: OBJ_FOM

parameters.Name: SHAPE_FSUB
parameters.Description: Age-dependent SHAPE multiplier of the parameter NCAP_FSUB.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: OBJ_FSB

parameters.Name: SHAPE_FTAX
parameters.Description: Age-dependent SHAPE multiplier of the parameter NCAP_FTAX.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: OBJ_FTX

parameters.Name: SHAPE_FLO
parameters.Description: Age-dependent SHAPE multiplier of the parameters FLO_FUNC/FLO_SUM.
parameters.Affected Equations/Variables: COEF_PTRAN

parameters.Name: YEARVAL
parameters.Instances: A value for each year.
parameters.Description: Numerical value of year index (e.g. YEARVAL('1984') equals 1984).

parameters.Name: AGG_OUT
parameters.Description: Commodity production by an aggregation process: Production of commodity (c) in period (t) and timeslice (s) from other commodities aggregated into c.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity Units

parameters.Name: CAP_NEW
parameters.Description: Newly installed capacity and lumpsum investment by vintage and commissioning period: New capacity and lumpsum investment of process (p) of vintage (v) commissioned in period (t).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity Units
parameters.Details/Notes: uc_n indicates UC tags INSTCAP and LUMPINV

parameters.Name: CM_RESULT
parameters.Description: Climate module results for the levels of climate variable (c) in period (t).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Various climate units

parameters.Name: CM_MAXC_M
parameters.Description: Climate module results for the duals of constraint related to climate variable (c) in period (t).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Dual values / Marginals

parameters.Name: CST_ACTC
parameters.Description: Annual activity costs: Annual undiscounted variable costs (caused by ACT_COST) in period (t) associated with the operation (activity) of a process (p) with vintage period (v). Additional indicator (uc_n) for start-up costs.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_COMC
parameters.Description: Annual commodity costs: Annual undiscounted costs for commodity (c) (caused by COM_CSTNET and COM_CSTPRD) in period (t).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_COME
parameters.Description: Annual elastic demand cost term: Annual costs (losses) due to elastic demand changes of commodity (c). When elastic demands are used the objective function describes the total surplus of producers and consumers, which reaches its maximum in the equilibrium of demand and supply.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_COMX
parameters.Description: Annual commodity taxes/subsidies: Annual undiscounted taxes and subsidies for commodity (c) (caused by COM_TAXNET, COM_SUBNET, COM_TAXPRD, COM_SUBPRD) in period (t).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_DAM
parameters.Description: Annual damage cost term: Annual undiscounted commodity (c) related costs, caused by DAM_COST, in period (t).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_DECC
parameters.Description: Annual decommissioning costs: Annual undiscounted decommissioning costs (caused by NCAP_DCOST and NCAP_DLAGC) in period (t), associated with the dismantling of process (p) with vintage period (v).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_FIXC
parameters.Description: Annual fixed operating and maintenance costs: Annual undiscounted fixed operating and maintenance costs (caused by NCAP_FOM) in period (t) associated with the installed capacity of process (p) with vintage period (v).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_FIXX
parameters.Description: Annual fixed taxes/subsidies: Annual undiscounted fixed operating and maintenance costs (caused by NCAP_FTAX, NCAP_FSUB) in period (t) associated with the installed capacity of process (p) with vintage period (v).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_FLOC
parameters.Description: Annual flow costs (including import/export prices): Annual undiscounted flow related costs (caused by FLO_COST, FLO_DELV, IRE_PRICE) in period (t) associated with a commodity (c) flow in/out of a process (p) with vintage period (v) as well as capacity related commodity flows (specified by NCAP_COM, NCAP_ICOM, NCAP_OCOM).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_FLOX
parameters.Description: Annual flow taxes/subsidies: Annual undiscounted flow related costs (caused by FLO_TAX, FLO_SUB) in period (t) associated with a commodity (c) flow in/out of a process (p) with vintage period (v) as well as capacity related commodity flows (specified by NCAP_COM, NCAP_ICOM, NCAP_OCOM).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_INVC
parameters.Description: Annual investment costs: Annual undiscounted investment costs (caused by NCAP_COST) in period (t) spread over the economic lifetime (NCAP_ELIFE) of a process (p) with vintage period (v).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_INVX
parameters.Description: Annual investment taxes/subsidies: Annual undiscounted investment costs (caused by NCAP_ITAX, NCAP_ISUB) in period (t) spread over the economic lifetime (NCAP_ELIFE) of a process (p) with vintage period (v).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_IREC
parameters.Description: Annual implied costs of endogenous trade: Annual undiscounted costs from endogenous imports/exports of commodity (c) in period (t) associated with process (p) and vintage period (v), valued according to the marginal(s) of the trade equation of process p.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_PVC
parameters.Description: Total discounted costs by commodity (optional, activate by setting RPT_OPT('OBJ','1')=1): Total present value of commodity-related costs in the base year, by type (with types COM, ELS, DAM). See Part III, Section 3.10 on the reporting options, and Table 16 below for acronym explanations.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_PVP
parameters.Description: Total discounted costs by process (optional, activate by setting RPT_OPT('OBJ','1')=1): Total present value of process-related costs in the base year, by type (with types INV, INV+, FIX, ACT, FLO, IRE, where INV+ is only used for the split according to hurdle rate). See Part III, Section 3.10 on the reporting options, and Table 16 below for acronym explanations.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency
parameters.Related Sets/Parameters: CST_INVC, CST_INVX, CST_FIXC, CST_FIXX, CST_ACTC, CST_FLOC, CST_FLOX, CST_IREC

parameters.Name: CST_SALV
parameters.Description: Salvage values of capacities at EOH+1: Salvage value of investment cost, taxes and subsidies of process (p) with vintage period (v), for which the technical lifetime exceeds the end of the model horizon, value at year EOH+1.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: CST_TIME
parameters.Description: Discounted value of time by period: Present value of the time in each model period (t) by region (r), with s='ANNUAL' and uc_n='COST'/'LEVCOST' depending on whether the $SET ANNCOST LEV reporting option has been used.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Year

parameters.Name: EQ_PEAK.L
parameters.Description: Peaking Constraint Slack: Level of the peaking equation (EQ_PEAK) of commodity (c) in period (t) and timeslice (s).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity Units

parameters.Name: EQE_COMBAL.L
parameters.Description: Commodity Slack/Levels: Level of the commodity balance equation (EQE_COMBAL) of commodity (c) in period (t) and timeslice (s), where the equation is a strict equality.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity Units

parameters.Name: EQG_COMBAL.L
parameters.Description: Commodity Slack/Levels: Level of the commodity balance equation (EQG_COMBAL) of commodity (c) in period (t) and timeslice (s), where the equation is an inequality.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity Units

parameters.Name: F_IN
parameters.Description: Commodity Consumption by Process: Input flow (consumption) of commodity (c) in period (t) and timeslice (s) into process (p) with vintage period (v), including exchange processes.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity Units

parameters.Name: F_OUT
parameters.Description: Commodity Production by Process: Output flow (production) of commodity (c) in period (t) and timeslice (s) from process (p) with vintage period (v), including exchange processes.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity Units

parameters.Name: OBJZ.L
parameters.Description: Total discounted system cost: Level of the ObjZ variable, equal to the value of the objective function.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: P_OUT
parameters.Description: Commodity Flow Levels by Process (set RPT_OPT(NRG_TYPE,'1')=1 to activate, see Part III): Output flow level (power level) of commodity (c) in period (t) and timeslice (s) of process (p). By default only Output levels are reported, but with RPT_OPT(NRG_TYPE,'3')=2, input levels are reported as negative values.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Power Units

parameters.Name: PAR_ACTL
parameters.Description: Process Activity: Level value of activity variable (VAR_ACT) in period (t), timeslice (s) of process (p) in vintage period (v).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Activity Units

parameters.Name: PAR_ACTM
parameters.Description: Process Activity – Marginals: Undiscounted annual reduced costs of activity variable (VAR_ACT) in period (t) and timeslice (s) of process (p) with vintage period (v); when the variable is at its lower (upper) bound, the reduced cost describes the increase (decrease) in the objective function caused by an increase of the lower (upper) bound by one unit; the reduced cost can also be interpreted as the necessary decrease or increase of the cost coefficient of the activity variable in the objective function, for the activity variable to leave its lower (upper) bound.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Marginal Costs

parameters.Name: PAR_CAPL
parameters.Description: Technology Capacity: Capacity of process (p) in period (t), derived from VAR_NCAP in previous periods summed over all vintage periods. For still existing past investments, see PAR_PASTI.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity Units

parameters.Name: PAR_CAPLO
parameters.Description: Capacity Lower Limit: Lower bound on capacity variable (CAP_BND('LO')), only reported, if the lower bound is greater than zero.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity Units

parameters.Name: PAR_CAPM
parameters.Description: Technology Capacity – Marginals: Undiscounted reduced costs of capacity variable (VAR_CAP); only reported in those cases, in which the capacity variable is generated (bound CAP_BND specified or endogenous technology learning is used); the reduced costs describe in the case, that the capacity variable is at its lower (upper) bound, the cost increase (decrease) of the objective function caused by an increase of the lower (upper) bound by one unit. The reduced cost is undiscounted with COEF_PVT.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Marginal Costs

parameters.Name: PAR_CAPUP
parameters.Description: Capacity Upper Limit: Upper bound on capacity variable (CAP_BND('UP')), only reported, if upper bound is smaller than infinity.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity Units

parameters.Name: PAR_COMBALEM
parameters.Description: Commodity Slack/Levels – Marginals: Undiscounted annual shadow price of commodity balance (EQE_COMBAL) being a strict equality. The marginal value describes the cost increase in the objective function, if the difference between production and consumption is increased by one unit. The marginal value can be determined by the production side (increasing production), but can also be set by the demand side (e.g., decrease of consumption by energy saving or substitution measures).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Marginal Costs

parameters.Name: PAR_COMBALGM
parameters.Description: Commodity Slack/Levels – Marginals: Undiscounted annual shadow price of commodity balance (EQG_COMBAL) being an inequality (production being greater than or equal to consumption); positive number, if production equals consumption; the marginal value describes the cost increase in the objective function, if the difference between production and consumption is increased by one unit. The marginal value can be determined by the production side (increasing production), but can also be set by the demand side (e.g., decrease of consumption by energy saving or substitution measures).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Marginal Costs

parameters.Name: PAR_COMNETL
parameters.Description: Commodity Net: Level value of the variable corresponding the net level of a commodity (c) (VAR_COMNET). The net level of a commodity is equivalent to the total production minus total consumption of said commodity. It is only reported, if a bound or cost is specified for it or it is used in a user constraint.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity Units

parameters.Name: PAR_COMNETM
parameters.Description: Commodity Net – Marginal: Undiscounted annual reduced costs of the VAR_COMNET variable of commodity (c). It is only reported, if a bound or cost is specified for it or it is used in a user constraint.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Marginal Costs

parameters.Name: PAR_COMPRDL
parameters.Description: Commodity Total Production: Level value of the commodity production variable (VAR_COMPRD). The variable represents the total production of a commodity. It is only reported, if a bound or cost is specified for it or it is used in a user constraint.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Commodity Units

parameters.Name: PAR_COMPRDM
parameters.Description: Commodity Total Production – Marginal: Undiscounted annual reduced costs of the commodity production variable (VAR_COMPRD). It is only reported, if a bound or cost is specified for it or it is used in a user constraint.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Marginal Costs

parameters.Name: PAR_CUMCST
parameters.Description: Cumulative costs by type (if constrained); Level of cumulative constraint for costs of type (uc_n) and currency (c) in region (r).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Currency

parameters.Name: PAR_CUMFLOL
parameters.Description: Cumulative flow constraint – Levels: Level of cumulative constraint for flow of commodity (c) of process (p) between the year range (v–t).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Flow Units

parameters.Name: PAR_CUMFLOM
parameters.Description: Cumulative flow constraint – Marginals: Shadow price of cumulative constraint for flow of commodity (c) of process (p) between the year range (v–t). Not undiscounted.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Marginal Costs

parameters.Name: PAR_EOUT
parameters.Description: Electricity supply by technology and energy source (optional): Electricity output of electricity supply processes by energy source; based on using NRG_TMAP to identify electricity commodities, but excludes standard and storage processes having electricity as input. (Opted out by default – set RPT_OPT('FLO','5')=1 to activate; see Part III, Section 3.10).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Power Units

parameters.Name: PAR_FLO
parameters.Description: Flow of commodity (c) entering or leaving process (p) with vintage period (v) in period (t).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Flow Units
parameters.Details/Notes: See F_IN/F_OUT

parameters.Name: PAR_FLO_M
parameters.Description: Discounted reduced costs of flow variable of commodity (c) in period (t) of process (p) with vintage period (v); the reduced costs describe that the flow variable is at its lower (upper) bound, and give the cost increase (decrease) of the objective function caused by an increase of the lower (upper) bound by one unit; the undiscounted reduced costs can be interpreted as the necessary decrease / increase of the cost coefficient of the flow variable, such that the flow will leave its lower (upper) bound.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Marginal Costs

parameters.Name: PAR_IRE
parameters.Description: Inter-regional exchange flow of commodity (c) in period (t) via exchange process (p) entering region (r) as import (ie=’IMP’) or leaving region (r) as export (ie=’EXP’).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Flow Units
parameters.Details/Notes: See F_IN/F_OUT

parameters.Name: PAR_IREM
parameters.Description: Discounted reduced costs of inter-regional exchange flow variable of commodity (c) in period (t) of exchange process (p) with vintage period (v); the reduced costs describe that the flow variable is at its lower (upper) bound, and give the cost increase (or decrease) of the objective function caused by an increase of the lower (upper bound) by one unit; the undiscounted reduced costs can be interpreted as the necessary decrease / increase of the cost coefficient of the flow variable in the objective function, such that the flow will leave its lower (upper) bound.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Marginal Costs

parameters.Name: PAR_IPRIC
parameters.Description: Inter-regional trade equations – Marginals: Undiscounted shadow price of the inter-regional trade equation of commodity (c) via exchange process (p) in period (t) and timeslice (s). The undiscounted shadow price can be interpreted as the import/export price of the traded commodity. Note: ucn={IMP/EXP}.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Marginal Costs

parameters.Name: PAR_NCAPL
parameters.Description: Technology Investment – New capacity: Level value of investment variable (VAR_NCAP) of process (p) in period (v).
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity Units
parameters.Details/Notes: Note v=t for this variable.

parameters.Name: PAR_NCAPM
parameters.Description: Technology Investment – Marginals: Undiscounted reduced costs of investment variable (VAR_NCAP) of process (p); only reported, when the capacity variable is at its lower or upper bound; the reduced costs describe in the case, that the investment variable is at its lower (upper) bound, the cost increase (decrease) of the objective function caused by an increase of the lower (upper) bound by one unit; the undiscounted reduced costs can be interpreted as the necessary decrease / increase in the investment cost coefficient, such that the investment variable will leave its lower (upper) bound.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Marginal Costs

parameters.Name: PAR_NCAPR
parameters.Description: Technology Investment – BenCost + ObjRange (see Part III, Section 3.10 for more details): Cost-benefit and ranging indicators for process (p) in period (t), where uc_n is the name of the indicator: COST, CGAP, GGAP, RATIO, GRATIO, RNGLO, RNGUP.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Varies

parameters.Name: PAR_PASTI
parameters.Description: Technology Capacity: Residual capacity of past investments (NCAP_PASTI) of process (p) still existing in period (t), where vintage (v) is set to '0' to distinguish residual capacity from new capacity.
parameters.Units/Ranges/Defaults: Capacity Units
